headline: Jane Timken: ‘I Have the Best Ground Game’ for GOP US Senate Race in Ohio
author: NationalWatch
sentences:
Jane Timken: 'I Have the Best Ground Game' for GOP US Senate Race in Ohio (Newsmax//'Spicer & Co.'')
By Jay Clemons | Monday, 18 April 2022 08:07 PM
Ohio U.S. Senate hopeful Jane Timken says her campaign has pounded the pavement like no other candidate competing in the May 3 Republican primary.

In her countless conversations with Ohio voters, Timken says three campaign issues stand out: the chaos at the U.S.-Mexico border, the United States experiencing 40-year highs with inflation, and the Parental Bill of Rights involving educational matters with children.

Appearing Monday on Newsmax, Timken — the former chair of the Ohio Republican Party — told "Spicer and Co." co-hosts Lyndsay Keith and Logan Gidley that her team and support staff have personally reached out to 1.4 million Ohio voters.

According to Real Clear Politics, a site that tracks polls for the midterm elections, Republican candidates Josh Mandel (leading one poll) and Mike Gibbons (two polls) are the current front-runners with Ohio GOP voters.

Original Article

Earlier this week, GOP candidate JD Vance received an endorsement from former President Donald Trump, earning the nod over GOP contenders Timken, Mandel, Gibbons, Matt Dolan, Bill Graham and Neil Patel.
Libertarian Dominic LaCavera, Shawn Mousourakis of the Veterans America Party and three independent candidates will be on the Nov. 8 general election ballot, according to Ballotpedia.
Look, [Trump's] endorsement of JD Vance has, quite frankly, upset a lot of the Trump base, especially because they know what JD Vance said about President Trump back in 2016."
But that won't deter Timken from dreaming of a Republican primary victory … and then a general-election Senate battle, likely taking on Rep. Tim Ryan, D-Ohio.
Inflation is skyrocketing, the borders are burning, and parents want someone who's going to stand up for them, and their rights in education," Timken said.
Voters have not forgotten that and … and we are out there every single day, earning the vote of Ohio Republican primary voters."
"Trump's endorsement of JD Vance was disappointing, but we are still planning on winning this race," Timken said.
He called, most importantly, the Trump Ohio voters 'uneducated' and 'racists' at the Ohio Republican primary.
The people who were in the trenches and the real [Make America Great Again] supporters know who was there."
Along with Rep. Ryan, Morgan Harper and Traci Johnson are also running in the Democratic primary.
"I have the best ground game to do that, and we're going to be out campaigning every day.
Note: See Newsmax TV now carried in more than 100 million U.S. homes, on DirecTV Ch.
This is going to be who can turn out their voters," said Timken, an Ohio native.
I have a history of defeating Democrats as chair of the Republican Party.
… I delivered Ohio for President Trump by more than [8 points in 2020].
Rob Portman, she said, "has endorsed me over 200 elected officials.
"We have the best ground game … this is going to be a turnout race.
Timken continued: "JD Vance was a self-proclaimed Never Trumper.
"We have too much at stake [with the November midterms].
The blue wave crashed in Ohio," Timken said.
"We kept our congressional delegation.
"I'm the one who can defeat Tim Ryan.
We're going to win this race."
